users.about: Rumspringa was eye opening for me, so I decided to leave my community, move to Miami, and pursue my dream of working on the beach as a software developer. Outside of work you can find me basking in the Miami sun while downing margaritas by the pitcher.

I currently work for DoorDash as a Junior Web Developer, which is PERFECT because I think I'm their #1 customer! I can't get enough deliveries from Cheesecake Factory. In my free time outside of work, I enjoy brunch with my squad and trying out the cutest new Instagram murals.

My path to being a software developer took me down many tracks. For over 20 years I was a railroad engineer. My passion for trains still thrills me today, passing my time building a backyard train which my grandkids love to ride, as well as my museum-grade model train I love to customize in my basement.
I'm just a small-town girl looking for her cowboy to sweep me off my feet. This is the weirdest dating site I've ever been on, but I'm open to trying new things, so here we are!

When I'm not improving my coding skills, you can find me in a trench sporting my authentic Civil War Era uniform and reenacting the great battles of our forefathers. God Bless America and those who died defending this great country.

You think water moves fast? You should see ice. It moves like it has a mind. Like it knows it killed the world once and got a taste for murder. After the avalanche, it took us a week to climb out. Now, I don't know exactly when we turned on each other, but I know that seven of us survived the slide... and only five made it out. Now we took an oath, that I'm breaking now. We said we'd say it was the snow that killed the other two, but it wasn't. Nature is lethal but it doesn't hold a candle to man.
I'm a passionate web developer with a love for front-end design. When I'm not coding, you'll find me exploring new hiking trails and capturing beautiful landscapes through my camera lens.
I'm a software engineer who enjoys building scalable applications. My coding journey started with a fascination for video games, and now I create my own game mods in my free time.
As a back-end developer, I specialize in optimizing server performance. Outside of work, I'm an avid reader and love discussing classic literature with fellow enthusiasts.
I'm a coding enthusiast who's always up for a challenge. When I'm not coding, you'll find me experimenting with new recipes and perfecting my culinary skills.
I'm a front-end developer with a passion for creating stunning user interfaces. In my spare time, I'm an amateur photographer capturing the beauty of everyday life.

posts.title: Lightbulb Moment Using For Loops
posts.body: Today I learned that I can use a for loop  in JavaScript to iterate through items in an array, that was pretty cool. I can now make a list based on an array of items!

posts.title: Is anyone else in the dark about this...
posts.body: I just found out that my cohort will be learning C# during our backend portion of the boot camp... I'm SO CONFUSED!

posts.title: React is confusing but fun??
posts.body: I feel like React is very useful and awesome, and I enjoy the way it works, but I'm struggling with the differences in managing state... I feel a breakthrough coming though!!

posts.title: I am feeling really comfortable with HTML
posts.body: I know that's not much of an accomplishment for most of you, but reading HTML was so hard for me... SO GOOD NEWS...after 8 weeks I'm finally finished with Deshaun's Dog Walking and never felt better!!!

posts.title: Some words of wisdom from my mentor
posts.body: He told me to just. do. better. I don't think I'll ever be able to look at coding the same again.

posts.title: Figuring Out React
posts.body: Do you see any Teletubbies in here? Do you see a slender plastic tag clipped to my shirt with my name printed on it? Do you see a little Asian child with a blank expression on his face sitting outside on a mechanical helicopter that shakes when you put quarters in it? No? Well, that's what you see at a toy store. And you must think you're in a toy store, because you're here shopping for an infant named Jeb.
